Harry417 - this is a span-zipped archived - the ISO image has been compressed into multiple files which are each 25MB big with the exception of the last file.  If you simply select all of the files & tell them to extract, the entire ISO image will unzip to the folder you're in.  Hope this helps.

Simenfuru if you're getting the message "GLW_StartOpenGL() - could not load OpenGL subsystem", this is usually a reference to the graphics card you're using.  http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/OpenGL has some details of this - basically it's a programming enhancement that allows more complex designs to be drawn by the graphics card - a lot of games require OpenGL capability.  It's most likely that your graphics card either doesn't support OpenGL or it's running on a lower version of OpenGL than the game requires.  The other possibility is that there was an error in the download but that is somewhat more unlikely.  Check out http://www.jediknightii.net/reqs.shtml to confirm your graphics card either meets or is above the spec suggested.

To all who have OpenGL problem: 
I had same problem with it's sequel - Jedi academy. On my ATI card with Win 7 the game couldn't open,
 and this post solved it: forums.anandtech.com/showthread.php?t=2090882
Newer versions of ATI catalyst drivers don't support older OpenGL games, but there's a way to make older drivers work without downgrading drivers for the whole system. So, both games have the same Q3 engine and perhaps you can make it run with this..

Anyone who has the open GL issue on newer OS's such as Vista and Windows 7.  

Run the game as admin, disable visual themes, and run the game in compatibility mode.
